name: Hotel Alcantara

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If good value for money is a vital thing, try the Alcantara in Barrio Santa Cruz in Seville. We stayed there for three nights in August and are very pleased with the hotel, the staff, their friendly approach and of course the location. In the middle of everything that counts when visiting Seville for a few days. This was great.
reviews.title: Great location in the Santa Cruz area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Alcantara worked out very well for us, a family of four. The room we had was ample for all four of us, had a nice bathroom and minifridge, and internet. The biggest plus is the location, being in the Barrio Santa Cruz in the old part of Seville. While in the old section, the hotel itself is quite modern. They have places to sit, relax and talk with others both inside and out.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in the historical area

likes.liked: — Location is right where you want to be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are also to be commended. They were friendly and honest, plus always ready to help.
reviews.title: Small ideally situated hotel

likes.liked: — Ideal situation for eating out and sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a flamenco performance right next door as well, which was adequate for us at the time.
reviews.title: Great Location and Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast (5 Euros) was very good. I am not sure you could do better on the street.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a fairly comfortable and clean choice. The WIFI worked well and the front desk staff were welcoming. A bit pricey for its standard, I nevertheless have no regrets about staying there for the three nights, though I would not recommend a longer stay. A superb location, this is the hotel's strongest point. We drove there from Malaga and parked in the nearby public car park (€19 per day). Afterwards, we just parked on the street - though take care, as Seville motorists have a rotten habit of double parking, as we discovered one morning and had terrible trouble manouvering the car out of its space!
reviews.title: Okay hotel in a fine location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was basic with two single beds which felt small and rattled against a loose headboard whenever one moved. The hangers in the wardrobe were ruined and immediately fell down whenever a shirt was placed on them. I noticed other complaints about this and still the management have not got round to changing them. This simply isn't good enough! Our room 11 was above the Flamenco show, but I heard no noise whatsoever from downstairs, the only disturbance came from the toilet upstairs which seemed to flush just above the beds! The room was cool - ideal in summer but less so in late October. The heating system is very poor, but the water is fine and hot.
reviews.title: Great Hotel close to sites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: At €5, the breakfast was good value. Unfortunately, there are only four tables and the chances of finding an empty table after 9am are about one in three. If you don't mind waiting and watching whilst the other guests eat then this might not bother you. It bothered me. It being too cold to eat outside on the terrace, I can see why the hotel does not include breakfast in their price; there simply isn't the space for the number of guests.
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All said, the hotel was okay.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the middle of all the sites you want to see in Seville. It is in a very small pedestrian street. We took a taxi from the train station and it took us as close as possible to the hotel. It is about 50 yds from the street. Clean bedroom, very friendly and helpful staff, FREE wifi and comfortable room. Would stay again in this hotel.
reviews.title: Sweet front desk staff, GREAT location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the Santa Cruz area within minutes to the Cathedral you may think it would be noisy... Quiet with a central courtyard the Alcantara offers basic and clean accommodation with friendly and very helpful staff. Just off the foyer you'll find a small theatre that offers nightly flamenco shows for EU 15. At the price it is great value.
reviews.title: Oasis in a busy part of Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh there is a great local bar with good tapas at Bodeguez Faviola... Just four minutes away.
reviews.title: In the heart of Sevilla, and the typical walking streets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a bit hard to find when you travel by car, but worth the search. the staff is friendly and hosting. The hotel is in very good conditions and the rooms and beautiful. Breakfast is perfect to start a good visiting day of one of the most beautiful cities of Andalusia. you will have to park the car few blocks away in a public parking which is not cheap, but on the other hand, you're at a walking distance from the cities's attractions and restaurants... This was a great experience.
reviews.title: Great location, average room, great desk personnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In the middle of the Barrio Santa Cruz, easy walking distance to the cathedral and the Alcazar and everything else touristy in Sevilla. Stayed 1 night. Very basic, no frills, nothing fancy but nothing to complain about either, except a little mildew on the grout in the shower (but otherwise totally clean). Quiet (room was on the 2nd floor). Encountered 3 desk staff, all of whom were very helpful and professional. Didn't bat an eye when asking if the 2 of us, both women, wanted beds together or apart. They arranged for an early AM taxi upon departure and even gave us a handout explaining how much the taxi ride should cost. And fortunately for us, all the desk personnel spoke excellent English.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we paid 89 euros, which seemed expensive but about par for the course for Sevilla hotels.
reviews.title: Location location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a nice hotel in sevilla, we were there in september,staff were the best,you can ask them for any information,everything within walking distance, perfect since you go to sevilla to walk and discover all the beautiful places, thank you to all your staff.
reviews.title: wonderul place in sevilla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I was skeptical at first of this establishment, due to the lower price. But it was a great place to stay in Seville. We had two rooms, a single and a double and both rooms were standard sized for Europe, very clean, and had air conditioning. No in room safe. Free Wi-Fi in hotel, with strong signal. The 5 Euro breakfast is well worth it. We did not get it the first day and spent way more at a cafe down the block for mediocre food. Staff was very helpful, friendly and provided great service. I would also recommend the flamenco show next door to the hotel. The rooms were quiet, facing the courtyard. We really enjoyed the central location and walked everywhere in Seville.
reviews.title: Great Value for Money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned after staying at Hotel Alcantara for 4 nights, the location was ideal,most of the sights where within walking distance, the staff were very helpful and the rooms clean and quiet. We would not hesitate in staying at the Alcantara again if in Seville. Breakfast was 5 euros. All in all excellent.
reviews.title: Great Location & Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: That was one of the nicest hotels I stayed in Spain. The reception personnel was very helpful.
reviews.title: Quiet but cental location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a room at 4th floor, facing the patio, so I didn't hear any noise from outside. The room itself was small but I only missed a good chair for reading or watching the tv. The location in the old town was good, still a walking distance from the railway station.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel. Good Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back in December we had a short break to Andalucia visiting Seville, Cordoba and Granada. We stayed at the Alcantara for 2 nights. The location is excellent, in the old town with its very narrow streets, and not too far from the bus station. The Cathedral and Palace are within easy walking distance. Our twin room was very quiet, and although on the small side, was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good Location and Quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The help yourself breakfast was good, with ad lib coffee, toast, cheese etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Family friendly
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: Make sure you have a decent map showing its' location though - the Old Town is like a maze, it was late evening when we arrived in Seville and for a while we were lost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I and our three year old daughter stayed here for two nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They also spoke english just fine.
reviews.title: Outstanding boutique hotel in the city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is priced very fair for such an awesome location. It is very close to the Cathedral and is inside the Barrio Santa Cruz which is the safest (and some would say nicest) neighborhood in Seville.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a nice hotel in a great location, this one is for you. The rooms are clean, with all the normal facilities provided and the aircon works in the heat of August ! Its 5 Euro for the breakfast, which is the normal continental fayre- rolls, cereal, ham, cheese and cakes. Juice and hot drinks are plentiful. Its a 5 min walk to the cathedral area but the narrow streets take some getting used to !
reviews.title: great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and friendliness of the hotel staff is excellent and there are free safety deposit boxes in the staff area.
reviews.title: Disappointed in no cancellation policy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very hard to fault for a 2 star hotel
reviews.title: Exceptional well located within old Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked 2 days ago and then found out we will not be able to make it to Sevilla after all on this trip. Since it's several days ahead of time & no charges had been put on the credit card yet, Expedia was nice enough to call them & talk to them. I was hoping for at least a "cancellation charge" of $25 or something like that - but they're going to keep the whole $79. ;(
reviews.title: Great little hotel, near all the sights!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This kind of short-sighted attempt to make money will hurt them in the long run as this kind of service does not make me want to recommend them and the next time I visit Sevilla again I will probably pick another hotel.
reviews.title: Affordable and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. Before we reached the place we were not happy with the as they had declined to book places at a Flamenco show that happens next doors to them - later came to know that most hotels dont work with show as they are not very organised in terms of advance bookings.
reviews.title: An Amazing place with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That settled, we check-in to find decent sized rooms which were of 3* standards. The hotel has a lovely location in the heart of Barrio Santa Cruz. The staff, even though they have their own breakfast buffet for an extra charge, recommended a superb churroria nearby where we could buy our churros and sit at El Modesta next doors, order chocolate and other stuff and have a nice breakfast.
reviews.title: Wonderful people and hotel!
Hotel Alcantara
reviews.text: Only shortcoming I can think of is lack of common facilities other than one coffee machine (self-service for 1 Euros)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Clean, spacious room, wonderful reception staff, great location! Great flamenco club next door, too.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from Seville and stayed at the Alcantara. A really nice hotel, staff very friendly and can't help you enough. Bedrooms really nice, clean and tidied every day. Breakfast is really good and relaxing, plenty to choose from. Went for a meal on the first night to a restaurant (Alcamira) just down the road from the hotel. The waiter recommended the lamb which came on the bone and we didn't realise was charged by the weight, so the meal ended up costing quite a bit. Needless to say we didn't go back there again. All the other restaurants we went to were very reasonable. We went on the bus tour around Seville, just to get our bearings, very informative. We also went on the bullfighting tour which was also very interesting. The cathedral is worth a visit and also Seville football stadium were we watched a football match. The atmosphere was great and people very friendly. There is also a roman baths which is worth a visit, very relaxing. Seville is very traditional and I would definately go to there again and say at the Alcantara. GREAT PLACE.
reviews.title: Great choice found on tripadvisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just returned from my second trip to the excellent Hotel Alcantara in Seville.
reviews.title: My second visit to this great hotel

likes.liked: — Right in the middle of Historic Seville . All attractions were within easy walking distance.
likes.disliked: — No tea and coffee in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In the middle of Santa Cruz about 5 mins from the Real Alcazar , it is in in the most beautiful part of Seville. It is not the most luxurious hotel in the world , but you are not paying luxury prices.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is, however, an excellently run and well located hotel. The staff are just as kind ,friendly and helpful as on my last trip in 2006. In fact Irecognised most of them from then. Always a good sign I think !
reviews.title: Great location, friendly hotel

likes.liked: — convenient to all of the sites, restaurants, tapas bars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: You could not find better value for your money.
reviews.title: Super clean and functional
Outstandingly good value
reviews.text: This time I went with a friend and we had a triple room for the two of us. Unfortunately as the hotel was full ( you do need to book in advance it is very popular ) and we paid for the extra unneeded bed. If there had been three of us it would have been a tight squeeze especially as the wardrobe was quite small.

description: New Hotel Alcántara offers comfortable and modern installations at the heart of Seville's historical center. It is located in the Santa Cruz district, next to the famous Murillo gardens, declared "of Cultural interest".
